conclusion marshal speedily gave order necessary under circumstance have occurred on lucy being recovered from swoon found that have not be prey of hideous dream a at first supposedbut that husband have be taken from lodged in strong rooma maniac murderer oh what heart rending duty be for to implore to take courage for child sake walkden who have in meantime be restored to sens begged to make house home in future look on a fatherbut shrieked forth negative in so wild tone accompanied by such shudder that wretched man must not be otherwise than deeply convinced how ineffable be abhorrence that entertained for marshal kindly took charge of stricken woman young child corpse of scudimore be conveyed to room there to await attendance of coroner on following day little more remains to be told during night followed deplorable event have just related alexander craddock grew furious with excitement became raving mad brain fever supervened in le than twelve hour from moment when hand avenged wrong on villain scudimore be no longer denizen of world ten day afterwards marshal received letter from walkden subsequently showed to content of ran thus a nearly a can recollect ' be about to quit england will never be again heard of by one who have to much reason to shudder at mere mention of name allude to deeply injured daughter in law share of ten thousand pound of scudimore plundered husband be precisely one half amount with compound interest have placed in fund in name implore to forgive man who be crushed heart broken who loathes himself'lucy who have only for child sake be able to sustain anything like adequate amount of courage necessary to support affliction be somewhat solacedif solace there must be in midst of such bitter bitter woeby certainty that child be now secure against want accordingly removed with into small comfortable dwelling near norwoodbut not before have called on to express gratitude for kindness have be enabled to show family moreover endeavoured to compel to receive sum of money a said in repayment for amount have at various time lent that sum be hundred time greater than have ever be able to assist with must not receive fraction wept on parting with a if have be own daughter during year survived loss of husbandfor only did survive yearshe came frequently to visit always accompanied by child on occasion brought touching delicate memorial of esteem health have be undermined by long vigilsthe deep anxietiesthe corroding caresthe serious toilsand frightful shock have characterised existence in accursed prison died in arm of affectionate female friend who dwelt in neighbourhood whose bosom misfortune have deeply touched friend promised to be second mother to poor child have fulfilled word two respectable gentleman accepted guardianship of orphan so far a pecuniary interest be concerned orphan will be rich when become of agefor walkden died short time ago leaving fortune poor lucy sleep in same grave with husband thus end tale of sorrow old man wiped away tear from eye frank curtis be not only deeply interested in narrative have just heard even affected by lamentable detail on be about to make remark when happening to glance from window espied captain on parade staring about in possible direction curtis therefore took leave of mr prout after thanking for recital of melancholy tale hastened to join friend captain o'blunderbuss have good news to relate officer in possession in baker street have positively refused to allow mr curtis to take thing beyond wearing apparel away with excellent lady have accordingly moved with two trunk five child to lodging in belvidere place captain have likewise be unsuccessful in visit to sir christopher blunt have seen knight be true menace coaxing have proved potent enough to induce gentleman to draw forth purse sign autograph to cheque what devil then must do demanded frank curtis shuddering a thought of poor side be jasus go dacently genteelly through insolvent court exclaimed captain will skin commissioner alive if dar r to turn back frind really think there be other alternative left to petition court observed frank curtis therefore will make up mind at once to do so chapter cix prisoner must leave mr frank curtis to adopt necessary measure in order to effect emancipation from bench vi insolvent court suppose that month have passed since period when blackamoor consigned to dungeon tim snammer josh pedler old death mr bunce husband tidmarsh be about nine o'clock in evening when blackamoor attended by csar who bore light entered subterranean passage containing door of cell in prisoner be separately retained wilton followed bearing large basket two more of black retainer brought up rear one carrying naked cutlas other pair of loaded pistol in hand opening door of first cell blackamoor took light from csar hand stopping on threshold said timothy splint sun have set close of day have come have be surrendered up to justice of criminal tribunal of country must ere have ceased to exist guilt must have be expiated on scaffold oh must rather have be that exclaimed man in tone carried to heart of listener conviction of sincerityi must rather have be that than frightful lingering in utter darkness light sir be a welcome to a food must be if be starving added with profound emphasis be afraid to be alone in dark enquired blackamoor be hell upon earth sir cried tim snammer what can ask whether be afraid when place be haunted with dreadful spectre spectre be created by own guilty conscience answered black mildly solemnly then advancing farther into dungeon so that light fell upon haggard countenance of prisoner said see that there be horrible apparition now why must not remain here when can enjoy use of eye a well a when be involved in darkness be what say to be what be always asking exclaimed timothy splint yet ca help thinking that be therethe murdered man knowwith throat so horribly cutoh yeswhen be alone in dark be sure be therejust where be standing now never moveshe stand a still a deathand eye glare upon in dark be dreadfuldreadfuland wretched criminal hid face in hand be sorry then that killed sir henry courtenay asked black sorry repeated splint in thrillingagonising tone wish must only live last few month over again 'd sooner beggo to workhousebreak stone in roador even starve than rob do thing wrong again oh must indeed for see now that though man may only mean for to rob stand chance of taking away life be horridhorrid thing to say to one self ' be murderer ' be more horrid still to see dreadful spectre always standing by onequite plain though in darkand never taking cold eye off assassin if have light timothy splint must no longer think of crime said blackamoor then must be ready to fall back into old course if have liberty given to once more heaven forbid exclaimed man frame convulsed with horrible shudder wish have never known such course at wish must live over again during whole period have be so wicked be sure must be good man thenif so be have experience to teach to be so never thought be such shocking thing to be wicked till came to be left alone in darknessyes alone with frightful thought must sooner be put to death at once butbut added in hesitating manneri have courage to brain against wall because spectre of murdered baronet seems to stand by to prevent have then ever thought of suicide since first became prisoner here enquired blackamoor often often sirvery often exclaimed splint emphatically never told before yet have visited regularly evening to bring food talk to for short time said blackamoor never spoke to so kindly a do now sir cried criminal earnestly when man have be upwards of thirty daysyes have counted visit be thirty firstwhen man say have be thirty one day alone in darkness except for few minute evening begin to feel want of hearing human voiceand when voice speaks in kind manner timothy splint tone have gradually become tremulous now burst into tear yesthe villainthe robberthe murderer wept be tear such a have not shed for long long time when river be ice bound by cold hand of winter seems unconscious of presence of flower thrown on impenetrable surface when thawed by warm sun flowing naturally again stream open bosom to receive rose bud caress with sparkling ripple waft gently along a if rejoiced at companionship so be with heart of man slightest word spoken in kind manner be now borne on by current of feeling thawed from state of dull long enduring obduracy crime be manifold great said blackamoor there be hope for even vilest added unable altogether to subdue profound sigh contrition be remains for sinful mortal who can not recall past be penitent siri be very penitent can assure exclaimed man in tone of deep emotion few week ago must have be ashamed to utter thing now doe good to say soand will tell something more sir continued after moment hesitation though suppose will not believe speak frankly said blackamoor well siri have tried to recollect prayer last night when repeated thought that spectre gradually grew le le plain to view at event seemed le horrible be praying again when came just nowand will pray presentlyfor know that there be consolation in do well to pray timothy observed blackamoor must not like to be able to read book if only have candle bible sir exclaimed man speaking under influence of feeling deeply excited unquestionably sincere think must even yet be happy in dreadful dungeon what make fancy that bible must render happy enquired black because used to read when be lad remember that contains many good saying answered splint besides declares somewhere that there be hope for sinner who repent must like to keep eye fixed at time upon god own promise be sure that mind must be easier for though know that promise be given yet feel desire to repeat over over again to myselfand also to learn whether god ever forgave one who be so bad a be will have light book said blackamoor oh be jestingyou be deceiving cried splint must be so cruel sir on part be not jestingthe subject be too serious to be treated lightly be answer then making sign to wilton to step forward took from basket dependant carried lamp already trimmed couple of book there be volume of talesand there be bible continued take whichever prefer bible if please sir cried splint eagerly while countenance denoted most unfeigned joy know not how to thank enough for kindnessand tear again started from eye have chosen tale must not have have book light said black wilton now gave prisoner plate containing bread cold meat bottle of water while csar lighted lamp door be then again closed upon man be already true penitent whispered blackamoor to wilton let now visit late companion in iniquity party proceeded to next cell in joshua pedler be confined two armed dependant stationing in manner a to be visible to inmate of dungeon when door be opened thank god be come again cried starting up from bed moment light flashed in upon why do come with sword pistol in fashion demanded savagely in case must offer resistance answered blackamoor choose to put chain upon therefore be compelled to adopt necessary precaution when visit in manner really must not harm siri must not for world said pedler in milder tone be not cruelthough severe feel very grateful to for not giving up to justice hope be not offended with for speaking a did try to be patienti endeavour to be mild what be then that irritates temper enquired blackamoor own thought sir answered josh pedler bitterly just before heard key grating in lock be thinking what fool have be for so many year how happy might be perhaps if be labouring man be sorry that have be wicked observed black interrogatively so must one be when come to be locked up here in dark returned man be very well when one be at liberty have friend to talk to plenty of drink because company gin can prevent body from thinking herehereoh be quite different opinion be that dark dungeon be much worse punishment than transportationleastways judging by have heard from men have be transported have come home again when time be up must rather be transported at once thenor remain here enquired blackamoor must sooner remain here for several reason said pedler in first place want to get into bad company again because be afraid must go wrong once moreand in second place know that thought have be good for though be not pleasant if must minute join of old friend to drink smoke with must not gladly do so asked black scarcely know how to answer sir replied pedler musing be afraid mightand yet be very certain that must be fool for pain must sooner earn honest living somehow must like to have good thoughtsbut be impossibleimpossible added shaking head gloomily why be impossible demanded black because man to have good thought must do something be good be prompt rejoinder have be wicked fellow for so many year wish have be good be too late now be never too late to repent said blackamoor know that bible promise observed pedler then people must never believe that rascal like must become good for thing besides after have happened hope for opportunity of showing that feel how stupid have be to lead life a have done who must trust with work what honest person must associate with be use questioning sir see that even feel comfortable in visiting place since come with armed people if must obtain liberty by killing must not do asked black a true a be there must not harm hair of head cried josh pedler emphatically shudder when think of dreadful business down at cottage yonderin fact ca bear to think of say that be actually afraid at being in dark darkness cause terrible thought seems a if mind have eye must shut against particular thingsand now have found out much must be long time before did wrong deed again even if be turned out into midst of london very minute without penny in pocket what must do if be set free moment demanded blackamoor at same time suppose that be about to have liberty be not mad enough to fancy possible replied josh pedler if such thing did happen must go to matildathe gal spoke to about sir who be now in comfortable position added black yesthanks to kindness said man must like a long a lived if be only on account of what have done for a be going to tell yousupposing be set free must take 'tilda with into countryas far away from london a possible then 'd change name try to get work ah must be happy continued with profound sigh if must only earn enough to keep in little hut make talk in way longer feel justjust a if ii be going to cry man voice became faltering tremulous a uttered last word lash be moistened with tear must feel pleasure in writing letter to matilda asked blackamoor in kind tone yesabove thing eagerly cried criminal be great penman must make out scribbling dare sayand must do good to give proper advicei mean just to let know what thought be at time besides now that be separated from find that liked moreyesa good deal more than used to fancy did must be glad to beg forgiveness for what made do when be sick in want will have light writing material observed black be good mani feel that be sir exclaimed josh pedler tear now trickling down cheek if have only fallen in with person a yourself when be young must have turned out a did though people may never know that be possible for fellow like to alter yet altered mind isand look on thing a used to do wilton gave josh pedler supply of food lamp writing material dungeon already containing table in addition to other necessary plain homely article of furniture criminal be overjoyed at indulgence shown on occasion of visit saw door close upon with feeling seemed to have experienced great relief end of vol of second series printed by j fautley bonner house seacoal lane london transcriber note several entry in table of illustration be missing reference page
